intro: Maytenus bailadillana, commonly known as the Chilean mayten, is a shrub or small tree native to South America, particularly Chile and Argentina. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by berries that turn red when mature. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Maytenus bailadillana is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
